benchmark_details.name: Codecfake
benchmark_details.overview: Codecfake is a large-scale dataset for detecting ALM-based deepfake audio, comprising over 1 million audio samples in both English and Chinese, designed to tackle challenges in audio deepfake detection and improve generalization capabilities across diverse test conditions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset for the detection of ALM-based deepfake audio and advance research in audio deepfake detection methods.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The current dataset only includes clean audio conditions, lacking robustness in complex real-world noise environments.

data.source: Comprises audio samples generated from a variety of neural audio codec models.

methodology.calculation: EER calculated during evaluation on different test conditions including codings and unseen audio types.
methodology.interpretation: Lower average EER indicates better performance in distinguishing between real and fake audio samples.
methodology.validation: The validation of the dataset was done through its application in training and testing audio deepfake detection models.
